results.title: Metrication: managing the change over
results.creator_credit: Charles Pascoe, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Attempts to show how a company changeover to the metric system can be planned and implemented in order to minimise costs and maximise benefits. Indicates the type of senior management decisions required following the initial tasks survey and discusses how metrication should be implemented, timed and monitored in relation to cost effectiveness.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Pascoe, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Metric
results.brief_description: A little of the history of measurement. Metric is the whimsical story of the ubiquitous metre, It promises to do nice things for us, like wiping out confusion. It even promises to be simple and logical, a luxury we can hardly afford to neglect. Or is the whole film just a pretext for entertainment? In any case, the film comes up with mathematics that are eminently digestible, even to the arithmetically disinclined.

results.title: Methods of water rescue
results.creator_credit: Maria Boldini, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
A team of schoolboys demonstrate, both on land and in the water, methods of rescue, release and resuscitation. Shows methods of rescue for calm and struggling patients; release from the clutch of a panic-stricken patient; rescue methods for an unconscious patient; resuscitation by the Schaeffer methods; restoration of blood circulation by massage of the limbs. The film concludes with demonstration of a number of fancy swimming strokes.

results.title: Methods of family planning
results.creator_credit: Jan Steen, John Churchill and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description: Accurately and objectively explains the human reproductive cycle and all presently practised methods of practising it are seen as a matter of personal choice. Illustrates by animation. Avoids social and moral considerations.

results.title: Methods of educational enquiry. Part 5. Factor analysis (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Dr. John Bynner examines the conceptional stages involved in carrying out a factor analysis. He uses as an example children’s attitudes to school.

results.title: Methods - Drafting - Research
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Writers on Writing”.
Writers on Writing is based on a growing archive of video material, of conversations between contemporary writers discussing their work. The material has been re-edited to form a resource for students and teachers of English, and each of the six twenty minute videos focuses on different aspects and stages of the writing process. Each video is accompanied by a resource booklet. In this video, writers talk about how they go about the writing process and the role of drafting and research in their work.

results.title: Method study basic principles
results.brief_description: The systematic approach to method study — the essence of which lies in the critical questioning of existing procedures and which results in increased productivity, lower unit costs, easier work and higher earnings. Case examples come from garage work, furniture and electrical manufacture and Local Government.
